intro: Psychotria adpressipilis, commonly known as the "ayahuasca vine," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon basin. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white to greenish flowers. It is often found growing in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy. Its most notable feature is its use in traditional shamanic practices for its psychoactive properties.
